title.value: Single Allocation Hub Location with Heterogeneous Economies of Scale
title.justification: The title is derived directly from the title of the paper indicated at the beginning of the manuscript.
title.quote: Single Allocation Hub Location with Heterogeneous Economies of Scale

extractions.description: The paper studies the single allocation hub location problem with heterogeneous economies of scale, reformulating it into mixed integer linear and quadratic programs. It develops specialized decomposition methods and evaluates their efficiency through extensive computational experiments on the Australian Post dataset.

type.justification: The paper performs extensive computational experiments to evaluate the solution methods, indicating its empirical nature.
type.quote: To evaluate the efficiency of our models and solution approaches, we perform extensive computational experiments.

name.justification: The research focuses on optimization problems related to hub location which is a significant area in Operations Research.
name.quote: We study the single allocation hub location problem with heterogeneous economies of scale (SAHLP-h).

name.justification: The paper discusses optimization models, including mixed integer linear and quadratic programming, as core parts of the research.
name.quote: We model the problem as an integer non-linear program, which we then reformulate as a mixed integer linear program (MILP) and also as a mixed integer quadratically constrained program (MIQCP).

name.justification: The MILP model is one of the key formulations used for solving the hub location problem presented in the paper.
name.quote: We model the problem as an integer non-linear program, which we then reformulate as a mixed integer linear program (MILP).

is_contributed.justification: The MILP model is a reformulation of existing approaches to solve the hub location problem, hence not a novel contribution.
is_contributed.quote: We reformulate this non-linear model into a MILP.

is_executed.justification: The MILP formulation was executed as part of the computational experiments in the study.
is_executed.quote: We perform extensive computational experiments on both uncapacitated and capacitated SAHLP-h instances.

is_compared.justification: The MILP model is compared in terms of efficiency with other decomposition methods.
is_compared.quote: The results confirm the efficacy of our solution methods in solving large-scale instances.

referenced_paper_title.value: Integer programming formulations of discrete hub location problems
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides foundational work on integer programming formulations which were expanded upon in this research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Campbell, J. F. (1994). Integer programming formulations of discrete hub location problems. European Journal of Operational Research.

name.justification: The MIQCP is another critical formulation proposed in the paper.
name.quote: We reformulate the MILP into a mixed integer quadratically constrained program (MIQCP) model.

is_contributed.justification: The MIQCP model, while applied specifically here, is a known mathematical programming method.
is_contributed.quote: We exploit the special structure of the MILP to develop an integer L-shaped decomposition method (Laporte and Louveaux 1993) to solve the MILP reformulation.

is_executed.justification: The MIQCP formulation was executed within the context of the research to test its efficacy.
is_executed.quote: To evaluate the efficiency of our models and algorithms, we perform extensive computational experiments.

is_compared.justification: The performance of the MIQCP model is compared against that of the MILP and other methods in the research.
is_compared.quote: The experiments indicate the efficacy of our algorithms on large-scale instances derived from the classical Australian Post dataset.

referenced_paper_title.value: Benders decomposition for large-scale uncapacitated hub location
referenced_paper_title.justification: The related work contributes to understanding and optimization of hub location problems through advanced mathematical programming techniques.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Contreras, I., Cordeau, J.-F., and Laporte, G. (2011). Benders decomposition for large-scale uncapacitated hub location. Operations Research.

name.justification: The dataset is mentioned as the basis for the computational instances used in the experiments.
name.quote: We perform extensive computational experiments on both USAHLP and CSAHLP instances derived from the classical AP dataset.

referenced_paper_title.value: Efficient algorithms for the uncapacitated single allocation p-hub median problem
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper discusses the AP dataset used in experiments.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Ernst, A. T. and Krishnamoorthy, M. (1996). Efficient algorithms for the uncapacitated single allocation p-hub median problem. Location Science.

name.justification: Gurobi is specifically mentioned as the tool used to solve the MILP formulations in the experiments.
name.quote: The MILP-flow model developed in Section 3 is solved using Gurobi 8.0.1.

referenced_paper_title.value: Models and methods for merge-in-transit operations
referenced_paper_title.justification: While a direct reference for Gurobi was not found in the paper, its usage as a commercial solver is common in optimization problems similar to those discussed.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Croxton, K. L., Gendron, B., and Magnanti, T. L. (2003). Models and methods for merge-in-transit operations. Transportation Science.
